entry.title: Game: Mega Man X1 (SNES, 1993) (8)
entry.content:
Game: Mega Man X1 (SNES, 1993) (8)20131006
I played through this today with my son watching in about three
hours. I got everything and beat everything up to Sigma's final
form. I tried it a bunch of times but eventually gave up with my
best effort just getting him down to about 60% with one more
sub-tank unused. I dislike the steep difficulty in the second form
of most Mega Man bosses. On this playthrough of the game, I was
quite annoyed by the control scheme and that you can't rearrange
buttons. My hands hurt a lot at certain moments from trying to
hold a charge shot while wall-jumping all over.

Game     1: 7:04
Game     2: 2:41
Total time: 9:45
  • Video Games
  • Mega Man X1
  • SNES
  • 1993

entry.title: Game: Super Mario All-Stars (SNES, 1993) (5)
entry.content:
Game: Super Mario All-Stars (SNES, 1993) (5)20131006
I watched my kids play this for about thirty minutes. My daughter
got to the pipe first and was very excited to go underground. My
son beat 1-1 and was very proud of himself. They did so good. It
was so cute watching them giggle as the stomped and were stomped
by Goombas.

Total time: 0:41
  • Video Games
  • Super Mario All-Stars
  • SNES
  • 1993

entry.title: Game: Tales of Xillia (PS3, 2011) (16)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Xillia (PS3, 2011) (16)20131006
I played for about two hours and went through some lame
over-dramatic story sequences. I still find the battles
boring. I'm slightly tempted to stop playing, but I get the
impression I'm near the end. I just got back to outside Fennmount.

--

Later in the day, I did another two hours. I'm on my way to the
Marsh to fight the invading army. The boss fight at the castle was
a bit of a let down. It was cute the way everyone had something to
yell before the fight though. Afterwards was a ridiculous skit
about Jude learning what "bazongas" are. It is also cute the way
Milla and Jude are getting closer.

Total time: 31:44
  • Video Games
  • Tales of Xillia
  • PS3
  • 2011

entry.title: Book: Leviathan, by Thomas Hobbes (1651) (9)
entry.content:
Book: Leviathan, by Thomas Hobbes (1651) (9)20131005
His discussion of punishment is very odd. He says that the
Common-wealth does not give the right to punish to the Sovereign,
but that all people have the right to punish already. But, the
Common-wealth has laid down their right and in so doing as made the
Sovereign's right stronger. Very clever.
  • Books
  • 1651

entry.title: Movie: The Lizzie Bennet Diaries, starring Ashley Clements (2012)
entry.content:
Movie: The Lizzie Bennet Diaries, starring Ashley Clements (2012)20131004

entry.title: Movie: One Day, starring Anne Hathaway (2011)
entry.content:
Movie: One Day, starring Anne Hathaway (2011)20131003
This was a good movie, but I did not like the story. It was very
depressing from top to bottom, with someone ruining their life and
being a jerk to someone else until it was too late. Nevertheless,
it was a powerful story with a lot of nice moments.
  • Movies
  • 2011

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy 3 (remake) (DS, 2006) (5)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy 3 (remake) (DS, 2006) (5)20130927
I played for about an hour this morning. I made my way to the next
area with the Sea Dragon. I did a lot of grinding outside of the
cave and then decided to go in. I couldn't un-Mini myself to fight
the boss though, so it just creamed me. I guess I need to save a
casting of Mini for the battle. The game is very good... It's very
traditional but it has a lot of tightness that makes it a relaxing
grind.

Total time: 3:41
  • Video Games
  • Final Fantasy 3 (remake)
  • DS
  • 2006

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy 3 (remake) (DS, 2006)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy 3 (remake) (DS, 2006)20130921
I played for about forty minutes and just meandered
around... getting the first two characters and wandering around to
places where the enemies were way too hard. I haven't yet got jobs
and everything feels vaguely familiar, since I played the
beginning on NES, but still really different. I intend to continue
playing, although I'm quite lost. It seems like I should go into
the Mythril Mines, but everything is way too hard for me. I guess
I haven't explored the town enough... I just assumed there was
nothing except ghosts to find, but I really just looked in the
Magic and Blacksmith shops.

Total time: 0:42
  • Video Games
  • Final Fantasy 3 (remake)
  • DS
  • 2006

entry.title: Game: Lunar Knights (DS, 2007) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Lunar Knights (DS, 2007) (2)20130921
I played for about two hours today and beat two chapters. The gun
character is quite a bit different, but frustrating to control and
shoot things close to him. I also felt like the energy depleted
way too fast. In all the boss fights I've done, I've just gone
into Trance mode, spawned X, and won instantly. It's quite
boring. The loop in general isn't very fun. The space ship
segments are so weird that it is a nice divergence. I think I will
stop the game at Chapter 4.

Total time: 2:24
  • Video Games
  • Lunar Knights
  • DS
  • 2007
